website_summaries.verdict: This powerful, easy-to-install, and cool-running motherboard is an excellent deal for the price, especially if you need ultra-fast WiFi for gaming.
pros: Runs at an especially low temperature
cons: Its RGB LED software isn’t especially user-friendly

customer_reviews.title: Ryzen 3000 ready
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get a picture here for everyone to see- this MB has the latest bios that is Ryzen 3000 ready. It even says it on the package This MB was perfect for my build(3700x). Easy to install and an excellent price. The WiFi works flawless and it has plenty of headers for rgb, sata, and more. Would definitely buy again and hopes the picture helps those that are unsure about the compatibility
customer_reviews.author: Magic

customer_reviews.title: Great mobo for amd ryzen 7 2700
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, had the product for about 2 months now and have personally had zero issues. Was packaged well and arrived quickly. Im running a ryzen 7 2700, with 16 gigs of corsair vengence 3200 ddr4 ram, corsair 750 psu, amd msi rx580 8 gig oc video card, and a 500 gig ssd, all in a phantex p400 case
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Dispkay did not work without an additional graphics card.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get the MB going with the included display ports but was not able to do so. After installation and booting the computer there was not video when plugging in the monitor on either the HDMI port or the DVI port. No POST as well. I tried to get help form Gigabyte but to no avail. I have 4 computers running Gigabyte MB's but this was probably my last one. The only way to get this board going was to purchase a separate Graphics Card which increased the cost considerably. Why including a couple of monitor connectors if they do not work!?
customer_reviews.author: WernerJB

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great when it worked. But died after a month. Did not overclock and it did not over heat. Usually gigabyte makes descent boards but not sure what happened here.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Flawless
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the best value for an AM4 motherboard on the market. It has superb specs - very nice lighting and design - tons of options for wiring - supports 3200mhz ram. It boots very quickly, no unnecessary splash screen (something I used to hate on old Gigabyte mobos). The WiFi is phenomenal. It connected immediately and is very fast. So far, this has been a flawless piece of tech.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This had everything I needed and the price was great when I compared to buying a Mobo without WiFi/Bluetooth and having to buy a separate card instead. I'm running it with a mushkin 120gb nvme as the main boot, and a ryzen 2400g CPU with 16gb of Corsair lpx vengeance 2666 ram. My only complaint is some of the gigabyte software is really clunky and I haven't been able to add any new utilities to the gigabyte app, namely their fan speed controller. I also had issues with storemi which I ended up having to remove, reformat, and reinstall Windows 10 without it, but everything is running smoothly now without it.
customer_reviews.author: Wanat

customer_reviews.title: Well made mobo, with one thing worth noting.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it is a good mobo with appropriate material. However, if you want to use NVMe and M.2 SATA at the same time, pay attention to the dual M.2 connectors since you will either lose half bandwidth of your NVMe or give up installing the m.2 SATA SSD. =>The shorter one in the picture only supports PCIe x2 and does NOT support SATA interface. And, there is a longer one next to PCIe slot( which will be under graphics card if your graphics card need 2 or more slot width) supporting PCIe x4 and SATA. So, you can install NVMe under your graphics card giving up your M.2 SATA SSD, or install NVMe at low speed M.2 Connector.
customer_reviews.author: Takanashi

customer_reviews.title: Good for first pc build
customer_reviews.text: Great mother board. Was really easy to install windows with. I downloaded windows 10 to a flash drive and plugged it into a usb port and when the system turned on it knew to boot from the flash drive. I did not have to change any settings. I am using this with a second generation ryzen 5 processor so no bios update was needed. I got it while it was on sale and it had Bluetooth and WiFi which was an added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Nednarb

customer_reviews.title: Good Mobo Horrible Support
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard was very easy to install and works very well in my pc however the reason I payed the extra money for this mobo is the onboard wifi, however it never came with wifi antennas. I contacted Aorus customer support and they were a PAIN. After not getting a response for nearly 6 days, I provided my model number, bios number and proof of purchase and still asked me for a "more complete invoice". If Aorus doesnt screw up your product and it's extras, its a good mobo but unless you are missing something its all over. [Edit] After around 3 weeks, Aorus Support has sent me a replacement for my motherboard atenna. +1 star
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This MB came with the newest bios flashed on it which was a big relief since I have a ryzen 7 2700. The multiple point led control is awesome the leds are bright. Didnt see much performance upgrade switching from the gigabyte b450 wifi. One of the best MB to game with in my opinion and the fact it has a cover for the Nvme ssd is cool.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: WORKS WITH RYZEN 3000 SERIES!!
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard had me worried at first because of the reviews saying it was not ryzen 3000 compatible yet and that it would need a BIOS update before installation, but it didn't! If you go on gigabytes website and look up this motherboard you will see it is compatible. They need to update the amazon post though. For the people who said it needed a BIOS update, they probably don't know what they're doing. Great product, games well, looks great, LED's are sick. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Case

customer_reviews.title: Love this board!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a Ryzen 7, 32gb G.Skill ram setup and its amazing. The build quality and feel of the board is awesome it supports 64 gigs of RAM has multiple ports for SSD and onboard. The built-in IO panel on the back for all the ports was a great feature. The fan control pin setup works amazing for the setup that I have and I have not been happier. The built-in Wi-Fi and external antenna by far exceeds any card or Wi-Fi adapter that I've installed on a board in the past. The antennas are super strong and I do not have an issue connecting if I need to via Wi-Fi to the modem that's upstairs.
customer_reviews.author: DusteR

customer_reviews.title: Amazing mother board for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a huge step up from my last model, the lighting could better, the chip set is amazing, the blue tooth is very handy for my discord, the type c 3.1 is very good. If you see less than a 4.5 to a 5* on a rate it the person has no idea how to build pc. See a lot of 1 stars for it saying the can’t post a display, well most think it has on board graphics it doesn’t that has to do with your cpu, or they just didn’t seat the cpu properly. The WiFi on it is very good, range is limited but is expected.
customer_reviews.author: gary martin

customer_reviews.title: Great, but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product but, the software to adjust the RGB is actual garbage, the website for the motherboard is a pile of shit and ease of installation isn't very high. If you have a mid-tower like the NZXT H500 make sure to plug in the cables before installing your heat sink if it's big or else you'll have the hardest time getting your cables to plugin perfectly. Performance-wise it gets the job done and doesn't look half bad either. You have a decent amount of different RGB lighting modes (I believe anywhere from 5-10).
customer_reviews.author: FAHIM DHALI

customer_reviews.title: Video display does not work out of box
customer_reviews.text: I just got my motherboard in today and did the installation and none of the video ports on the board worked. I even have a graphics that did not display anything either. -EDIT- Received replacement motherboard and this second motherboard did not show video while using onboard video ports. but the replacement did support the graphic card this time. Would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P.

customer_reviews.title: Use M2's and loose all but 2 Sata ports
customer_reviews.text: Did not research this motherboard enough, specs looked good, 2 M-2 slots and 6 Sata ports. When I installed NVMe's in the m-2 slots I lost 4 of the Sata ports. I will have to install a Sata Pci-e card.
customer_reviews.author: Husky45

customer_reviews.title: Mine was not Ryzen 3000 ready
customer_reviews.text: For those looking to use this MB with a Ryzen 3000 series CPU, be aware that my MB that was ordered on 8/20 still had the F31 bios; meaning not Ryzen 3000 ready. I ordered based on another review having better luck with latest bios. I ended up getting a free Athlon loaner from AMD and updated to version f40 bios. On a side note, even with f40 bios i cant get it to boot. Im suspecting it may be due to a defective cpu... im still troubleshooting but wanted to give a heads up for anyone ordering for the same reasons as me.
customer_reviews.author: Scooba

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this board based on reviews and compatibility with the Ryzen 2400g chip. Wifi antenna works amazing get 100GBS which is all I pay for through my ISP. Manual was very clean on pins and where to plug things in for my first time building a machine it went very smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Amazing motherboard. Paired with ryzen 5 2600x and 32gb ram and a nvme m.2 SSD. Fast as heck. The on board wifi surprised me too. I usually run eithernet to everything but I figured I'd give it a try. Had 18 ping and 500 up and down with my fiber. Would highly recommend this for overclocking too cause the bios is super easy to use also.
customer_reviews.author: IsaFERD

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Dead on arrival. Single flash of onboard RGB and nothing else sense. No hassle refund/return because this is a common issue, go figure. I like the Gbyte brand, but I'm going to read reviews better next time.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Great board... Terrible RGB Software
customer_reviews.text: This thing is good for anyone that wants perks at value price. That being said... If you want ANY RGB customizing, organizing, etc. go with anything but Gigabyte. The RGBFusion 2.0 sucks @$$ and they should be ashamed for not letting any 3rd party link with its software.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley L.

customer_reviews.title: MOTHER BOARD VIDEO OUTPUTS DIDNT WORK + MORE NUISANCES
customer_reviews.text: My video outputs on the motherboard did not work, so I went and updated the bios from the manufacturers website and as soon as I updated the bios my computer wouldnt boot, need to buy a CD now in order to install windows again. Very upset with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: ClassyKye

customer_reviews.title: A lot of bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard is top notch. You get a lot of features for the money like Wi-Fi and RGB. This is my second Gigabyte motherboard and I am impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Matman (^^)

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this December 4th 2018 and over the yr ive been purchasing pc parts to build a new gaming pc... long story short today is August 17th 2019 finally got all the parts i need and... board wont power on. Soon as i turn the power switch on, the Rgb flash white and thats it.. like there is a grounded short or somthing...no post.. no boot.. no nothing... do not buy this crap save your money and find something else.. now i dont know when i will build this PC because buying a new board wasnt in my budget nore plans.... thanks gigbyte for wasting my time and money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan quinones

customer_reviews.title: ALMOST lasted six months
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard was great for a while until I upgraded to a ryzen 5 3600x. I updated to the latest BIOS and did everything necessary. The system did not boot with the new CPU and to make a long story short, after a lot of troubleshooting the problem was a defective board/defective CPU socket. I would expect to get an exchange for a working motherboard. This is a complete inconvenience and the process is certainly not desirable. I hope Gigabyte makes an effort to amend this for me.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Martin

customer_reviews.title: Well, it didn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I spent 4 hours putting together a major crunching computer. Upon firing it up, smoke billowed from underneath the cpu power block heat sinks. I unplugged the cpu, fired it up again, mobo showed cpu fault (as it should) and nothing else. Plugged it back in, turned on, within seconds, more smoke pouring out of the mobo. I'm two weeks past my Amazon return date, I'll update the star rating if the RMA process isn't too painful.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Hauschulz

customer_reviews.title: First Build
customer_reviews.text: I had a prebuilt before and swapped everything to a new board. I didn't really have any issues. The graphics on the vrm and heatsink are bubbling though. Still after 3 months the board is going strong. I have some occasional issues when booting and the RGB profile is set to something other than what I set it up as. Not entirely sure if that's a board issue or what.
customer_reviews.author: James Ledford

customer_reviews.title: It is an excellent product
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, I hesitated to buy this product. It turned out to be excellent, it has a ryzen 7 3700x and it already comes with the updated bios. supports 3rd generation ryzen. So far I had no problems. I recommend it 100% If you have a question fell free to ask. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: DOA POS
customer_reviews.text: It didn't work at all. It arrived dead, I only got a 2 second flash of light on the mobo. I waisted a lot of precious time diagnosing every piece of hardware refusing to believe it was the Mobo but it in fact was this POS that I waited months for to be in stock.
customer_reviews.author: Tuna's Castle

customer_reviews.title: Great Board
customer_reviews.text: I don't have too much experience with motherboards but so far this one has worked flawlessly. I mainly bought for the wifi but it has some other nice little features. Only taking off 1 star because I don't think it's very good for overclocking and for some reason my ram refuses to go to 3200 but that could be a number of different things . Not a huge deal though I definitely recommend it if you want built in wifi.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: GIGABYTE DOES IT AGAIN
customer_reviews.text: FABULOUS BOARD, ALL THE OPTIONS I WANTED, THE M2 CONNECTORS WITH COOLERS ARE FABULOUS, THE ONBOARD WI-FI (INTEL CHIP) IS MINT, THE MAGNETIC MOUNTED WI-FI ANTENNA WAS A BONUS, EASY SETUP, NO ISSUES, UPGRADED BIOS TO LATEST AND HAVE HAD -0- ISSUES. WAS AN INTERMEDIATE BUILD FOR AN I-RACING CLIENT AND HAS PERFORMED BETTER THAN EXPECTED.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Oetzel

customer_reviews.title: Bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad board at all. For the money it is hard to beat. While I prefer Asus products and will use MSI readily, the pricing and included WiFi make this hard to beat for included features, power delivery, and quality at this price point. That being said, I've had bad luck with lesser gigabyte models, bit these flagship boards are a reliable product. Night and day difference in experience between these and their cheaper models.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Ryzen 3000 Ready Out-Of-Box
customer_reviews.text: The motherboard is Ryzen 3000 ready out of the box. They haven't updated their description to include it but as you can see on the box, it is compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Des

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard.
customer_reviews.text: Keep in mind, If you want to use on board graphics and not spend money on a graphics card, you must have a cpu that supports it. Lots of reviews about how on board videos does not work. This motherboard is working great in my gaming PC build. Wifi is handy although it losses connection at times. Set my ram speeds just fine. Might consider getting a fan hub if you have lots of fans.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica R.

customer_reviews.title: It was good but sadly gigabyte needs to step up their game
customer_reviews.text: After seeing some reviews that "this has issues or dies within a month" I'm glad to say I have almost 3 months of use with this. And hope to have many more months after! ***EDIT*** Stopped detecting GPU after 6 months turns on but doesnt post and GPU is not the issue. Either I'm going to contact gigabyte or buy an Asus mobo since more people have better luck with it .
customer_reviews.author: Alan Lopez

customer_reviews.title: A nice flashy mid budget board
customer_reviews.text: First off, make sure your case supports full size ATX mobos. This one only gave me a few mm clearance around the edges in my Phanteks eclipse, but it’s workin great in the end. It’s got all the hookups you would expect on a modern mobo, runs fast and has RGB plugs if that’s your thing. Since it’s ATX, there’s enough room to work around everything too. One con: onboard hdmi and dvi outputs won’t work unless you buy a processor with GPU capabilities built in. Otherwise need a grafxcard
customer_reviews.author: UnrealTournament

customer_reviews.title: It failed in less than 60 days
customer_reviews.text: Failed in less than 60 days, Turned in RMA request to Gigabyte since I can't return it to amazon. It just fails to come on at all. Get the ASUS ROG Strix B450-F Gaming Motherboard instead. Same ballpark when it comes to money. I got the ASUS ROG at similar time and it is still functioning happily.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Mc Donald

customer_reviews.title: I had an Issue with the first, no problem with exchanging it , But!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am having a problem with the second 2 SATA port not working, change the SATA cable still not working. At the moment I am researching some of the youtubers Forum to see if it is a manufacture defect before I get back to Amazon, too see what option I have. Other than that I have no complaint, but now this is the complaint. Then I will update the REVIEW!!!
customer_reviews.author: CLIFTON J. CARR

customer_reviews.title: Great Motherboard. No issues.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this motherboard for my first pc build but was doubtful after seeing there is outdated bios issues with 3000 series Ryzen CPUs. I installed a Ryzen 5 3600 without needing to update the bios. Everything was simple to assemble and it’s running great.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Easy build
customer_reviews.text: Alot of questions were brought up on my build. First off it can use the Ryzen 5 3600x 6 core 12 thread . The bios is updated so this 3 gen processor will work with it. Straight forward no nonsense and I am an old school builder , last rig I built was 1997 so yeah very nice build very simple. Works amazingly well. I am very pleased with customer service as well , although I wish they had a number in the states . Other than that nice set up. Also fits very nicely into the Phantek P400 pics included.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissie K.

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard
customer_reviews.text: I have used this MB for a year now, and am still impressed with it's performance. The only negative, is that now I am beginning to hear a little audio "hum" when I move my mouse. Not sure if that's the board audio, or my speakers, but thought I should mention it.
customer_reviews.author: Skivywavr

customer_reviews.title: Board has an intrinsic manufacturing defect. Won't boot even to POST screen.
customer_reviews.text: DRAM and CPU led are blinking altogether after 1st power-up attempt, video board's fan doesn't even spin. After reading forums, I found that this particular model has the worst return rate in history. Piece of junk in nice package. Buyer, beware!
customer_reviews.author: Andrey V. Zvonarev

customer_reviews.title: If you want a cheaper Ryzen 3000 series MOBO that has wi-fi, this is an Ok choice
customer_reviews.text: Was a ble to plop in my R5 3600 CPU without any problems. However, this board does run hot and I have had an issue with my pc crashing when setting my 3600 mhz RAM to 3600 mhz so not sure if that's the board or the RAM.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: What an improvement!
customer_reviews.text: Jammed pack full of features. Fast interfaces and lots of connection options. I am running the os on the nvme and loving it. Very fast. This is a great step up from my old q6600 outfit. Great price for the feature set.
customer_reviews.author: Garrock

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Option for People Who Can't Use Ethernet!
customer_reviews.text: I can only use wifi because the box is in the other room, so this was the best option for me. The board itself comes with a lot of features such as being Ryzen 3000 series supported out of the box. Smart fans where you can change fan speed, bluetooth, and RGB.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Marquez

customer_reviews.title: Good motherboard. Terrible gigabyte software.  Should have stuck with Asus.
customer_reviews.text: Good motherboard for the money but gigabyte really needs to fix their software. Don’t bother downloading their software if you get a gigabyte motherboard. Just update drivers like lan, WiFi, chipset, Bluetooth, sound and stuff like that. I downloaded the app center, easy tuner, and the system information app for fans and i got a blue screen. rgb fusion works but I just use that in bios bc it’s buggy too.
customer_reviews.author: Henzy23

customer_reviews.title: Ryzen 3000 Ready...
customer_reviews.text: No bios update is required to use a Ryzen 3000 series processor. The rgb software (RGB Fusion) is trash, it couldn't detect my rgb fans but it can sync the colors of the motherboard and the fans. I also had trouble fitting this motherboard into my H510 case because of the integrated IO Sheild.
customer_reviews.author: Denny

customer_reviews.title: great with continued support
customer_reviews.text: great motherboard so far 3 months in. I'm using a ryzen 2600x in it and it is coasting along just fine. They have recently added Ryzen 3000 series support and the latest firmware update was 10/18/2019 as of this writing so they are still giving this board some love!
customer_reviews.author: R. Russell

customer_reviews.title: No problems after 8 months of use. Much respect for updated rgb driver supporting newer ram.
customer_reviews.text: zero problems, very cool looking, and having all the features competitors offer. I only wish I could use this board with my waterforce gigabyte videocard which I have in my main system.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great board
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the money. One of the better B450 boards in my opinion. It has many of the features of the high end boards at a fair price. It also came Ryzen 3000 ready so no Bios update needed if you are getting a 3000 series processor. Plus it looks great and if you’re like me you got a glass side panel so that matters too.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda Fox

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what it says it is.
customer_reviews.text: Still a solid choice for a 3rd gen Ryzen build (yes it comes w gen 3 ready bios). Given that a 2080ti still doesn’t saturate a pci gen 3 bus, and gen 4 storage is overpriced relative e to actual use cases; x570 is not needed by most users. Great board. WiFi setup is a bit strange w magnetic base but it works.
customer_reviews.author: James Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Easy install. I liked the included directions. Very easy to follow and this was my first build.
customer_reviews.text: Love this motherboard! It is super easy to install. It is well made and has plenty of fan connections. A found it interesting that unless you use the enclosed WiFi antenna, the board will not pick up on a WiFi signal, even if close to the router. It is a must connect feature.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect with all the features I need
customer_reviews.text: The Gigabyte B450 Pro Wifi works perfectly. I don't actually need the Wifi features, but I'm glad to have them if that ever changes. It was a breeze to install, easily recognized my M.2 PCIe device and Ram. You do have to activate XMP if you want your ram to run over a certain speed, but that's pretty standard nowadays. Overall I'm thrilled with the product and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin C.

customer_reviews.title: Looks elegant and stylish
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally ordered this on Amazon when I already bought it from a local store but this is still amazing despite being an entry-mid AM4 motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value for under 120$ can’t OC very high tho
customer_reviews.text: As long as your not wanting to OC anything crazy high it’s great has rgb m.2 slots plenty of fan and rgb ports first mobo in first build absolutely love it also WiFi works great I’m across house get great connections and when downloading!!!!!! The antenna it comes with is magnetic so it’ll stay on your pc case if your set it in there and looks like your pc has a shark fin 😂
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel

customer_reviews.title: research MoBo's before buying
customer_reviews.text: I got my B450 pro back in like March and haven't tried to use it until this week(October). I just barely got my cpu after all. Well apparently this board has a bad rep for being DOA and not working with Ryzen chipsets dispite being AM4 socket. I wish I did some research before I bought it so I wouldn't have wasted the $120 and time trying to find a new board that actually works. Don't get me wrong this board may work for other people but it didn't for me and I can't say that I'll roll the dice on a fresh B450.
customer_reviews.author: Leeland

customer_reviews.title: No problems here
customer_reviews.text: Great motherboard choice for putting together a ryzen 3000 series desktop PC. Runs perfectly, and easily overclock ram successfully. I was able to get hynix based ram rated for 2400 to run at 3600 no problem, using ryzen dram calculator.
customer_reviews.author: William Munn

customer_reviews.title: Took my Ryzen 3600 out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: Full featured motherboard that wasn't crazy expensive and was able to take my new Ryzen 3600 out of the box. Nice quality Bluetooth/wifi antenna that has good range. Everything was plug n play and easy to setup.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lammi

customer_reviews.title: Good value performance home computer board or low-end gaming board.
customer_reviews.text: AORUS PRO B540 with WiFi. Clean unpacking. Clean hardware setup. 100% working at power on. It’s a good value, low end gaming system With ddr4-2666 dram. Ryzen 2600 cpu with cooling fan. MSI GT-710 video card. Intel m.2 SSD. 500w atx power supply.
customer_reviews.author: MG00001

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great!
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I didn't like was that there were a couple leads in the upper left where it's a little blocked by the IO shield big lump of a thing, so that was a little difficult. But the board has been up and running for a couple months and doing great.
customer_reviews.author: Casper Moody

customer_reviews.title: don't buy before doing research
customer_reviews.text: Have had the board sitting for about 3 months it won't boot because the bois is wrong and I have to get another couple to fix it but have not had the money to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Great board for the money
customer_reviews.text: Amazing board for the cost of it. Only issue I have had is the Bluetooth module tends to drop my Xbox one controller occasionally so I have reverted to using a wired on and use my wireless on my laptop but not sure if the issue is from my controller not liking the board or an actual issue from the board. Overall really happy with it's performance and easy to use bios. Haven't tried using the control software for the LEDs as I have a solid case and not one with a window but haven't had any issues using it on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lovin' it!
customer_reviews.text: This board has been a pleasant surprise. Installing it was a breeze and the post install config was simple. Updating the bios was almost too easy. The over all performance is noticeable compared to my last board which was also a x450 board.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: The motherboard is just amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this board for a custom build for my son and it’s amazing! Worth every peeny!! The one thing I would warn people about is the M.2 slots. Top slot is for SSD. This was my first board that had M.2 so I had to read up on it.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Caught Fire!!!
customer_reviews.text: Put my PC together and when I started it up for the first time something shorted out on the board and caught fire briefly. In the pic I pointed out the location where it caught fire. I'm hoping it didn't fry my CPU or anything else. Do not buy this product!
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Solid board with lots of options
customer_reviews.text: I personally haven't had any troubles with this board so far. I didn't have to update the BIOS or anything to get it to recognize my CPU or any RAM speed issues. Looks slick and works just fine. Can't really ask for much else.
customer_reviews.author: Joleme

customer_reviews.title: I love Gigabyte
customer_reviews.text: As of 12/14/2019 this Mobo is running great for me. I actually purchased it used from the Amazon Warehouse. You could see where it was mounted before but nothing was damaged far as I could tell, I just built a budget PC centered around my RTX 2060 I had. My PC Gigabyte Aorus Pro Wifi B450 Ryzen 5 1600 Thermaltake 700w PSU G.Skill AEGIS DDR4 3000mhz 16gb Inland Premium NVMe M.2 512gb Gigabyte Gaming OC RTX 2060 6gb GDDR6
customer_reviews.author: Moses

customer_reviews.title: Ideal budget-ish solution
customer_reviews.text: This is the first motherboard I've purchased in the last 10 years that wasn't an ASUS board. I chose this board for the features and I/O as well as the cost(at time of purchase, it was on sale). I can't give it 5 stars because of the uefi/bios not being nearly as smooth to navigate as ASUS but if you don't plan on tweaking much then you have nothing to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: Jim R.

customer_reviews.title: One of the best boards
customer_reviews.text: I build many computers, and Gigabyte is always a go to brand for me when I want the biggest bang for my buck. The only issue I have with this board is the poor bios. The bios layout is just hard to navigate and find what you are looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Zigma

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Would not post. Like some others, alternating light for CPU and RAM. Tried taking it out of the case with the motherboard, memory, CPU only, and tried taking the RAM out also - still same result.
customer_reviews.author: Nerd_Ngong

customer_reviews.title: Great for a first build
customer_reviews.text: Built a computer with Ryzen 2600, 3000MHz Corsair memory and Radeon RX 580. solid, stable and predictable. easily got the 3000MHz clock on the memory. Get fan splitters if you want to use more than 5 case fans. One of mine is just sitting there for now.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: it just works
customer_reviews.text: plug and play on windows 10. Replaced cpu, memory and graphics card with it and I didn't have to mess with anything, Windows 10 just recognized the hardware and installed the necessary drivers!
customer_reviews.author: Gonzalo Krosnyak

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard with no issues so far.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great board to work with and did not have any issues until I had to disconnect a USB 3.0 from the board in order to insert another component. Unfortunately, I didn't line up great for the reconnect and bent/broke a pin from the USB 3.0 header. The board works as advertised and it should be great for me since I am not intending to work with any overclocking or other geek speak.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Morgan

customer_reviews.title: A real pleasure to work with.
customer_reviews.text: Could not have been easier to hook up all ports were clearly marked and the provided user manual made wiring to things like case on/off button easy. not bad at all for my first pc build went together like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: What’s not to like?
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been going strong on me for over 6 months now. Just got a 1660 GEFORCE GPU and the pc is running fantastic. I have older fans and I don’t deal with overheating whatsoever. I have the Ryzen 7 2700 and 32 GB of Trident RGB RAM. I also am a videographer, Premiere Pro runs great with 4K 10 bit files. A good investment for a intro-medium build :D
customer_reviews.author: Kaden

customer_reviews.title: Best value for features
customer_reviews.text: It’s one of the cheapest b450 boards with WiFi AND Bluetooth AND it comes with ryzen 3000 support without needing bios update If you’re having DRAM Led issues, put your ram sticks next to each other rather than one over
customer_reviews.author: Hakeem Balogun

customer_reviews.title: Hit or Miss
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my first build, triple checked everything, ended up not working with a flashing DRAM light. RAM works in another computer and I can't even get to the BIOS. After reading all over the internet these boards are either fantastic or busted out the gate as you can see from some other reviews. Do yourself a huge favor and get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: great item for the price
customer_reviews.text: great features. Only grip eI have is no 20 pin usb 3.1. Great rgb and have it synced with my Enermax saberray adv case
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: D.O.A.....
customer_reviews.text: Its a great board packed with decent features for a fairly low price, sadly it arrived dead on arrival i tried troubleshooting it for 3 days off and on till i managed to learn what i didn't want to learn total dud, i might attempt giving one of x boards a chance or i might just go with another company like msi, or asrock
customer_reviews.author: justin majhail

customer_reviews.title: It's ryzen 3rd gen ready
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good, just got it. Worked after 2 tries of unplugging cable but That was on me. Lights and good, and yes this works out of the box with a Ryzen 5 3600 which I was wondering the whole time cause I had no way of flashing the bios
customer_reviews.author: Luis Pence

customer_reviews.title: Good.
customer_reviews.text: Had my cousin build a PC with this, and it runs League super fast. Would recommend for the price.
customer_reviews.author: shawn

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My second gigabyte board, got for a budget build, looks great and works great, gigabyte has come a long way, would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great features  did my Ryzen 5 no problem  well made
customer_reviews.text: pros thermal shield coating on M.2 NVME slots/ pre installed backplate/ cons the case panel wires adapter
customer_reviews.author: mark woodruff

customer_reviews.title: GIGABYTE B450 AORUS PRO Wi-Fi
customer_reviews.text: Paired this MB with a Ryzen 5 3600X CPU and works great. No install issues at all. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jksleddin09

customer_reviews.title: Solid mobo.
customer_reviews.text: It works well; I've had no problems with it. The built-in WiFi is a cool feature that I used for a while before wiring everything up for increased ping (even if only a few ms).
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Harwood

customer_reviews.title: great value for money 💰
customer_reviews.text: I got it for my wify build, I got pair with a ryzen 2700x and rtx 2070 super, and is great, for gaming and working
customer_reviews.author: Eliezer Melendez

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loving me new motherboard all round excellent product! DONT LISTEN TO THOSE WHO SAY ITS CRAP!! I have my ryzen 5 2600x overclocked at 4.2mhz on all cores/threads using corsair hydro h45 AIO with my core voltage at 1.375 AMD recommends you dont go above 1.4 also sitting stable
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good luck needed
customer_reviews.text: Board came DOA. Couldn't believe it and bought another set of RAM to just confirm. Never posted kept flashing between CPU and DRAM. Tried reseating, resetting CMOS. Nothing
customer_reviews.author: 3rdMusketeer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Built a budget gamer. Works better than expected for this price point. Can't go wrong with Gigabyte!
customer_reviews.author: Dratharious

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard
customer_reviews.text: Had everything I needed to hook up has a nice leds on the motherboard that u can change what they do and colors also Only con if your tower has a gen 3.1 usc (c-port) doesnt have the plug need a adapter to wire it in. but has usb 3.0 plug
customer_reviews.author: Chris staples

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great for gaming. If you are a first-time builder, it's super simple every plugin is labeled on the board. Great by great performance.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Dee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome MOBO
customer_reviews.text: I 100% recommend, this MOBO is beautiful with some small RGB accents and works amazing. Great up gradable MOBO, good long term investment.
customer_reviews.author: momof2

customer_reviews.title: Great value board for Ryzen
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent board in terms of value for money. I have it paired with a R5 2600X but it’s ready for a gen 3 Ryzen processor too. The only (minor) complaint would be that it doesn’t have many fan headers, but it’s just about ok. No issues with installation.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Ryzen 5 3400 out of the box
customer_reviews.text: What a waste. You can't run the current Ryzen 5 without flashing the BIOS... You can't flash the BIOS without a supported CPU.
customer_reviews.author: AF.

customer_reviews.title: great board
customer_reviews.text: great motherboard good wifi signal. Not sure how a motherboard can be considered ''for gaming'' overall good value.
customer_reviews.author: Momofblessings

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard
customer_reviews.text: Awesome motherboard highly recommend to anyone looking for a RGB motherboard. I like it so much I have built both my computers with this motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Works, but....
customer_reviews.text: I have had alot of issues with BSODs and no video signal since building this PC. Turned out that one of the channels of memory on this board was bad. I moved my RAM from slot 1 to 3 and all is well. Too bad a brand new motherboard doesn't work properly out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: steven

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Built in wifi is awesome! Bluetooth works great and the Ryzen 2700x works like a champ in it!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Lackey

customer_reviews.title: True to its reputation
customer_reviews.text: I am a big Gigabyte fan as I have always had good luck with them in my builds. This one is no exception. It is exactly as advertised, installed easily and is working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wrong board.
customer_reviews.text: The ad calls it an ATX motherboard what was delivered was an ITX, would have been a big deal but thankfully the case I’m using can hold the board without issue but this could have been a huge deal for someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Gagne

product_meta.title: GIGABYTE B450 AORUS PRO WIFI (AMD Ryzen AM4/ATX/M.2 Thermal Guard with Onboard WIFI/HDMI/DVI/USB 3.1 Gen 2/DDR4/Motherboard)
product_meta.description: Supports AMD 2nd generation Ryzen/ Ryzen with Radeon Vega graphics/ 1ST generation Ryzen processors Dual Channel Non ECC Unbuffered DDR4, 4 DIMMs Intel Dual Band 802.11AC Wi Fi & BT 4.2 HDMI, DVI D ports for multiple display integrated I/O shield of Ultra durable Design Dual Ultra-Fast NVMe PCIe Gen3 M.2 (x4, x2) with dual thermal guards ALC1220 VB enhanced 114dB(Rear)/ 110dB(Front) SNR in microphone with WIMA audio capacitors RGB Fusion with Multi Zone LED light Show design, Supports Digital LED & RGB LED strips Intel Gbe LAN with cFosSpeed Internet Accelerator Software Smart Fan 5 features 6 Temperature Sensors and 5 Hybrid Fan Headers with FAN STOP app Center Including Easy Tune and Cloud Station Utilities CEC 2019 Ready, Save power with a single click. Atx Form Factor; 30.5 cm x 24.4 cm.
feature_bullets: Supports AMD 1st & 2nd generation Ryzen/ Ryzen with Radeon Vega graphics processors
Dual channel non ECC unbuffered DDR4, 4 DIMMs
Intel Ethernet LAN + Dual band 802.11AC Wi Fi
Dual PCIe Gen3 M.2 NVMe with dual thermal guards
Alc1220 vb enhanced audio with WIMA capacitors. Support for 11AC 160MHz wireless standard and up to 1.73 Gaps data rate. Intel WIFI driver only support for Win10 64bit
RGB Fusion with digital LED & RGB LED headers
USB 3.1 Gen 2 with USB type C & type A
Integrated I/O shield of ultra durable design
